message_1:
A math student wants to study the relationship between the number of hours spent studying and the grade received in a particular course. After collecting data from 20 students, the math student calculates a correlation coefficient of r=0.72. 

What is the coefficient of determination (r²)?
message_2:
The coefficient of determination (r²) is the square of the correlation coefficient (r). In this case, r = 0.72.

To calculate r², simply square the value of r:

r² = (0.72)² = 0.5184

The coefficient of determination (r²) is 0.5184.
